title: The glowing stone on the riverbank
body: He picked up the stone expecting it to be cold, but it pulsed warmly in his hand.

title: A quiet walk through the old district
body: The buildings leaned with age but held a certain beauty.

title: The last letter he never sent
body: It sat in his drawer for years, waiting.

title: A tavern full of strange faces
body: One hooded figure in the corner listened silently.

title: Rain on the old tin roof
body: The rhythmic tapping made him nostalgic for summers long gone.

title: The cat that stared too deeply
body: Its eyes were like swirling galaxies.

title: Footsteps in the empty hallway
body: He froze. The sound was unmistakable.

title: A promise made under the willow tree
body: They etched their initials into the bark.

title: The librarian who knew too much
body: She always seemed to know what book he needed.

title: The door in the basement wall
When the sky rained feathers
body: A single white feather floated down.
